title: How to Add Multiple Stories on Instagram

steps.title: Tap the Instagram icon.
steps.content: Tap the Instagram icon. The app icon is a camera inside a square that’s a gradient from yellow to purple. This will launch Instagram.

steps.title: Swipe from left to right to open your camera.
steps.content: Swipe from left to right to open your camera. You can also tap the camera icon in the top left corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the circular button to take a new picture for your story.
steps.content: Tap the circular button to take a new picture for your story. You can also hold down the button to record a video, select an image or video from your gallery, or make a video with special effects like the Boomerang or Rewind options at the bottom of the camera screen. [1] X Research source You can tap the two arrows icon to switch the active camera from forward-facing mode to backwards-facing mode. You can also add effects to your photos and videos by tapping the face icon.

steps.title: Add text, stickers, hashtags, or gifs to your photo or video (optional).
steps.content: Add text, stickers, hashtags, or gifs to your photo or video (optional). Tap the 4 icons to the right of the save button to see all of thee things you can add to your photo or video.

steps.title: Tap Send To >.
steps.content: Tap Send To > . You should see this in the bottom right corner of the screen. This will add your video or pictures to your story. You can also tap your profile icon in the bottom left corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the blue Share button next to Your Story.
steps.content: Tap the blue Share button next to Your Story .

steps.title: Repeat this process to add more photos or videos to your story.
steps.content: Repeat this process to add more photos or videos to your story.

steps.title: Tap the Instagram icon.
steps.content: Tap the Instagram icon. The app icon is a camera inside a square that’s a gradient from yellow to purple. This will launch Instagram.

steps.title: Tap or your profile image.
steps.content: Tap or your profile image. This is in the lower right of your screen. Your profile page will open. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the circular button above .
steps.content: Tap the circular button above . You should see this in the "Story Highlights" section of your profile page. A list of all your stories will appear. If you don't see this button, tap on the downward facing arrow next to Story Highlights to expand that section of your page.

steps.title: Select the story or stories you want to add to your profile.
steps.content: Select the story or stories you want to add to your profile. You can even choose an archived story here.

steps.title: Tap Next in the upper right corner of the screen.
steps.content: Tap Next in the upper right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type a title for your story and edit the cover image.
steps.content: Type a title for your story and edit the cover image. [3] X Research source You can edit the cover image by tapping Edit Cover . By dragging the image in the circle, you can see how the cover image appears. You can also pick an image from your photo storage by pressing the photo icon next to the cover image. The title for your highlight defaults to “Highlight”, but you have the ability to change that by tapping in the text field.

steps.title: Tap Add or Done.
steps.content: Tap Add or Done . Depending on your device, you'll either see an "Add" or a "Done" button. [4] X Research source This highlight will appear on your profile until you delete it. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat this process to add new Story Highlights to your profile page.
steps.content: Repeat this process to add new Story Highlights to your profile page.
